lines.text: [first lines]
[Mercy flirts silently with Brownie]
Best not be lookin', Brownie.
I ain't lookin'... as hard as I can.
Them pretty peach trees are sure a long way from Georgia.
Yep, but I expect to plant 'em where the ground is forty feet deep, black as charcoal and soft as a woman.
Now, whereabouts would that be? Heaven?
Oregon, Mister! Ain't ya heard?
We're mere men, but a man's nature is enormous. It contains both the great and the small. Even the meanest of us can be as large as this whole continent.
Lije, Lije, stay home this time!
I wish I could, but I can't.
Why?
I don't know why. It's just that I got to go where I've not been. And where I can say, "This far I've come, I can't go no further. Do you understand that?
Mercy, you're to stop flashin' in the fire every time a three-legged boy goes by. Now you hear me?
If we don't get that girl hitched before we get to Oregon, she's gonna run off and marry the nearest buffalo.
You know, it's no easy matter to share a vision - particularly for a man and a woman.
[the wagon train is surrounded by Indians]
He doesn't like what you're giving him.
What does he want?
Whiskey.
Whiskey?
Get 'em liquored up and maybe we could sneak off.
you could give it to 'em or they'll take it. I agree that the first one might be a little dangerous, but the second one could prove fatal.
I guess we'll have to fight, Dick.
Well, all right, but some of us are gonna have to settle for a piece of ground a little short of Oregon.
You know, for a smart man you ain't got a lick of sense! Not a speck!

[to Brownie after marrying him to Mercy]
I said 'amen.' You can kiss her even if you have before.

[Admiring Summers' necklace]
Hey, I noticed that mighty handsome possession. Did you get it off a ded Indian?
Yeah, my wife.
I'm sorry. It's just about the nicest possession I ever seen.
Well, it's about the only possession I got. That and my bad name. Well, eh, with Mr. Tadlock's very kind permission, we're gonna see if we can get ourselves killed. You want to ?
Oh, I never tried to stop anybody from doin' anything. That's about the only principle I got.
